MASH.NAME: Single Infusion, Full Body, Batch Sparge
MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 168.2 F

MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 168.2 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 159.1 F

MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 159.1 F

MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 163.7 F

MASH.NAME: Single Infusion, Medium Body, No Mash Out
MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 163.7 F

MASH.NAME: BIAB, Full Body
MASH.NOTES: Brew in a bag method where the full boil volume is mashed within the boil vessel and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash. No active sparging is required. This is a full body beer profile.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 20.00 qt of water at 169.7 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 7 min

MASH.NAME: BIAB, Light Body
MASH.NOTES: Brew in a bag method where the full boil volume is mashed within the boil vessel and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash. No active sparging is required. This is a light body beer profile.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 20.00 qt of water at 160.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 7 min

MASH.NAME: BIAB, Medium Body
MASH.NOTES: Brew in a bag method where the full boil volume is mashed within the boil vessel and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash. No active sparging is required. This is a medium body beer profile.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 20.00 qt of water at 165.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 7 min

MASH.NAME: Single Infusion, Full Body
MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 168.2 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 5.00 qt of water at 202.4 F

MASH.NAME: Single Infusion, Light Body
MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 159.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 8.00 qt of water at 203.8 F

MASH.NAME: Single Infusion, Medium Body
MASH.NOTES: Simple single infusion mash for use with most modern well modified grains.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 163.7 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 7.00 qt of water at 200.7 F

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 1 Step, Full Body
MASH.NOTES: Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 168.2 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 1 Step, Light Body
MASH.NOTES: Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 159.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 1 Step, Medium Body
MASH.NOTES: Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 163.7 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Decoction Mash, Single
MASH.NOTES: Used in some authentic German styles. Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash. Profiles vary. Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C. Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 20.00 qt of water at 126.6 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 8.22 qt of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Double Infusion, Full Body
MASH.NOTES: A full bodied mash profile for beers requiring a protein rest. Used for beer with large portions of unmodified adjuncts such as unmalted wheat.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 9.00 qt of water at 132.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 8.00 qt of water at 202.0 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 6.00 qt of water at 205.6 F

MASH.NAME: Double Infusion, Light Body
MASH.NOTES: Double step infusion - for light body beers requiring a protein rest. Used primarily in beers high in unmodified grains or adjuncts.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 9.00 qt of water at 132.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 8.00 qt of water at 183.2 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 9.00 qt of water at 209.8 F

MASH.NAME: Double Infusion, Medium Body
MASH.NOTES: Double step infusion - for medium body beers requiring a protein rest. Used primarily in beers high in unmodified grains or adjuncts.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 9.00 qt of water at 132.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 8.00 qt of water at 192.6 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 7.00 qt of water at 211.0 F

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 2 Step, Full Body
MASH.NOTES: Two step profile with a protein rest for mashes with unmodified grains or adjuncts. Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 129.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 156.0 F over 15 min

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 2 Step, Light Body
MASH.NOTES: Two step profile with a protein rest for mashes with unmodified grains or adjuncts. Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 129.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 148.0 F over 15 min

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Temperature Mash, 2 Step, Medium Body
MASH.NOTES: Two step profile with a protein rest for mashes with unmodified grains or adjuncts. Temperature mash for use when mashing in a brew pot over a heat source such as the stove. Use heat to maintain desired temperature during the mash.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 12.50 qt of water at 129.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 152.0 F over 15 min

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Decoction Mash, Double
MASH.NOTES: Used for some authentic German styles. Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash. Profiles vary. Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C. Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 20.00 qt of water at 126.6 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 6.42 qt of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 3.20 qt of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Infusion Mash with Precooked Adjuncts
MASH.NOTES: Long protein rests help to break down starches in precooked adjuncts in preparation for saccharification step.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 8.00 qt of water at 111.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 3.00 qt of water at 180.9 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 7.00 qt of water at 201.3 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 9.00 qt of water at 207.6 F

MASH.NAME: BIAB, Pilsner Step Mash
MASH.NOTES: Brew in a bag method where the full boil volume is mashed within the boil vessel and then the grains are withdrawn at the end of the mash. No active sparging is required. This is a pilsner mash profile that can be used for styles requiring high attenuation and/or modification.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Acid Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 20.00 qt of water at 98.8 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 125.6 F over 15 min

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification 1
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 145.4 F over 11 min

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification 2
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 161.6 F over 9 min

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 172.4 F over 6 min

MASH.NAME: Decoction Mash, Triple
MASH.NOTES: Authentic Germany mash schedule. Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash. Some sources recommend that each decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

MASH_STEP.NAME: Acid Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 20.00 qt of water at 97.1 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 5.34 qt of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 6.68 qt of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Saccharification
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 2.89 qt of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Heat to 168.0 F over 10 min

MASH.NAME: Decoction Mash, Triple, Lager
MASH.NOTES: Derived from Noonan, "New Brewing Lager Beer". A pure infusion/decoction mash with no temperature steps. The book recommends adding boiling water for the second step, though it appears it would come in too high in temperature. The first two decoctions are from the "heaviest" part of mash while the third is from the "thinnest". He also recommends you hold Dextrinization until it passes an iodine test (probably more than 20 minutes)

MASH_STEP.NAME: Dough-In
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 9.00 qt of water at 70.0 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Acid Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Add 6.25 qt of water at 165.6 F

MASH_STEP.NAME: Protein Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 2.92 qt of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Dextrinization Rest
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 6.33 qt of mash and boil it

MASH_STEP.NAME: Mash Out
MASH_STEP.DESCRIPTION: Decoct 5.29 qt of mash and boil it
